title.en: House of Zhou Bo, Marquis of Jiang
title.raw: 《絳侯周勃世家》 House of Zhou Bo, Marquis of Jiang

sentences.zh: 絳侯周勃者，沛人也。

translations.text: Marquis Jiang Zhou Bo was a native of Pei.

sentences.zh: 其先卷人，徙沛。

translations.text: His ancestors were from Juan, migrated to Pei.

sentences.zh: 勃以織薄曲為生，常為人吹簫給喪事，材官引彊。

translations.text: Bo made his living weaving reed mats, often played flute for people's funerals, served as a skilled crossbowman in the reserves.

Marquis Jiang Zhou Bo was a native of Pei. His ancestors were from Juan, migrated to Pei. Bo made his living weaving reed mats, often played flute for people's funerals, served as a skilled crossbowman in the reserves.

sentences.zh: 高祖之為沛公初起，勃以中涓從攻胡陵，下方與。

translations.text: When Gaozu as Duke Pei first rose up, Bo as attendant followed in attacking Hu Ling, captured Fangyu.

sentences.zh: 方與反，與戰，卻適。

translations.text: Fangyu rebelled, fought with them, drove them back.

sentences.zh: 攻豐。

translations.text: Attacked Feng.

sentences.zh: 擊秦軍碭東。

translations.text: Struck Qin army east of Dang.

sentences.zh: 還軍留及蕭。

translations.text: Returned army to Liu and Xiao.

sentences.zh: 復攻碭，破之。

translations.text: Again attacked Dang, broke it.

sentences.zh: 下下邑，先登。

translations.text: Captured Xiayi, first to ascend the walls.

sentences.zh: 賜爵五大夫。

translations.text: Granted rank of Grandee of the Fifth Degree.

sentences.zh: 攻蒙、虞，取之。

translations.text: Attacked Meng and Yu, took them.

sentences.zh: 擊章邯車騎，殿。

translations.text: Struck Zhang Han's chariots and cavalry, brought up the rear.

sentences.zh: 定魏地。

translations.text: Pacified Wei territory.

sentences.zh: 攻爰戚、東緡，以往至栗，取之。

translations.text: Attacked Yuanqi and Dongmin, proceeding to Li, took it.

sentences.zh: 攻齧桑，先登。

translations.text: Attacked Nie Sang, first to ascend.

sentences.zh: 擊秦軍阿下，破之。

translations.text: Struck Qin army below E, broke it.

sentences.zh: 追至濮陽，下甄城。

translations.text: Pursued to Puyang, captured Zhen city.

sentences.zh: 攻都關、定陶，襲取宛朐，得單父令。

translations.text: Attacked Duchuan and Dingtao, raided and took Wanju, captured Shanfu magistrate.

sentences.zh: 夜襲取臨濟，攻張，以前至卷，破之。

translations.text: Night raided and took Linji, attacked Zhang, advancing first to Juan, broke it.

sentences.zh: 擊李由軍雍丘下。

translations.text: Struck Li You's army below Yongqiu.

sentences.zh: 攻開封，先至城下為多。

translations.text: Attacked Kaifeng, first to reach the city walls with the most.

sentences.zh: 後章邯破殺項梁，沛公與項羽引兵東如碭。

translations.text: Later Zhang Han defeated and killed Xiang Liang, Duke Pei and Xiang Yu led troops east to Dang.

sentences.zh: 自初起沛還至碭，一歲二月。

translations.text: From first rising in Pei returning to Dang, one year two months.

sentences.zh: 楚懷王封沛公號安武侯，為碭郡長。

translations.text: King Huai of Chu enfeoffed Duke Pei with the title Peaceful Martial Marquis, made him magistrate of Dang commandery.

sentences.zh: 沛公拜勃為虎賁令，以令從沛公定魏地。

translations.text: Duke Pei appointed Bo as Commander of the Tiger Braves, as commander followed Duke Pei to pacify Wei territory.

sentences.zh: 攻東郡尉於城武，破之。

translations.text: Attacked the East Commandery Governor at Chengwu, broke him.

sentences.zh: 擊王離軍，破之。

translations.text: Struck Wang Li's army, broke it.

sentences.zh: 攻長社，先登。

translations.text: Attacked Changshe, first to ascend.

sentences.zh: 攻潁陽、緱氏，絕河津。

translations.text: Attacked Yingyang and Goushi, cut off the river crossing.

sentences.zh: 擊趙賁軍尸北。

translations.text: Struck Zhao Ben's army north of Shi.

sentences.zh: 南攻南陽守齮，破武關、峣關。

translations.text: South attacked Nanyang Governor Yi, broke Wuguan and Yaoguan.

sentences.zh: 破秦軍於藍田，至咸陽，滅秦。

translations.text: Broke Qin army at Lantian, reached Xianyang, extinguished Qin.

When Gaozu as Duke Pei first rose up, Bo as attendant followed in attacking Hu Ling, captured Fangyu. Fangyu rebelled, fought with them, drove them back. Attacked Feng. Struck Qin army east of Dang. Returned army to Liu and Xiao. Again attacked Dang, broke it. Captured Xiayi, first to ascend the walls. Granted rank of Grandee of the Fifth Degree. Attacked Meng and Yu, took them. Night raided and took Linji, attacked Zhang, advancing first to Juan, broke it. Struck Li You's army below Yongqiu. Attacked Kaifeng, first to reach the city walls with the most. Later Zhang Han defeated and killed Xiang Liang, Duke Pei and Xiang Yu led troops east to Dang. From first rising in Pei returning to Dang, one year two months. King Huai of Chu enfeoffed Duke Pei with the title Peaceful Martial Marquis, made him magistrate of Dang commandery. Duke Pei appointed Bo as Commander of the Tiger Braves, as commander followed Duke Pei to pacify Wei territory. Attacked the East Commandery Governor at Chengwu, broke him. Struck Wang Li's army, broke it. Attacked Changshe, first to ascend. Attacked Yingyang and Goushi, cut off the river crossing. Struck Zhao Ben's army north of Shi. sentences.zh: 項羽至，以沛公為漢王。

translations.text: Xiang Yu arrived, made Duke Pei King of Han.

sentences.zh: 漢王賜勃爵為威武侯。

translations.text: The King of Han granted Bo rank as Martial Marquis.

sentences.zh: 從入漢中，拜為將軍。

translations.text: Followed in entering Hanzhong, appointed as general.

sentences.zh: 還定三秦，至秦，賜食邑懷德。

translations.text: Returned to pacify the Three Qins, reached Qin, granted fief in Huaide.

sentences.zh: 攻槐裏、好畤，最。

translations.text: Attacked Huaili and Haozhi, first in merit.

sentences.zh: 擊趙賁、內史保於咸陽，最。

translations.text: Struck Zhao Ben and Chamberlain Bao at Xianyang, first in merit.

sentences.zh: 北攻漆。

translations.text: North attacked Qi.

sentences.zh: 擊章平、姚卬軍。

translations.text: Struck Zhang Ping and Yao Ang's army.

sentences.zh: 西定汧。

translations.text: West pacified Qian.

sentences.zh: 還下郿、頻陽。

translations.text: Returned and captured Mei and Fenyang.

sentences.zh: 圍章邯廢丘。

translations.text: Besieged Zhang Han at Fei Qiu.

sentences.zh: 破西丞。

translations.text: Broke the Western Chamberlain.

sentences.zh: 擊盜巴軍，破之。

translations.text: Struck the bandit Ba army, broke it.

sentences.zh: 攻上邽。

translations.text: Attacked Shangui.

sentences.zh: 東守峣關。

translations.text: East guarded Yaoguan.

sentences.zh: 轉擊項籍。

translations.text: Turned to strike Xiang Ji.

sentences.zh: 攻曲逆，最。

translations.text: Attacked Qu Ni, first in merit.

sentences.zh: 還守敖倉，追項籍。

translations.text: Returned to guard Aocang, pursued Xiang Ji.

sentences.zh: 籍已死，因東定楚地泗（川）［水］、東海郡，凡得二十二縣。

translations.text: Ji was already dead, thus east pacified Chu territory Sizui and Donghai commandery, altogether obtained twenty-two counties.

sentences.zh: 還守雒陽、櫟陽，賜與潁（陽）［陰］侯共食鐘離。

translations.text: Returned to guard Luoyang and Yueyang, granted to share eating Zhongli with Marquis Yingyin.

sentences.zh: 以將軍從高帝反者燕王臧荼，破之易下。

translations.text: As general followed Gaozu against the rebel King Yan Zang Tu, broke him at Yi Xia.

sentences.zh: 所將卒當馳道為多。

translations.text: The troops he led facing the imperial roadway were the most numerous.

sentences.zh: 賜爵列侯，剖符世世勿絕。

translations.text: Granted rank of noble, shared the tally never to be extinguished generation after generation.

sentences.zh: 食絳八千一百八十戶，號絳侯。

translations.text: Ate Jiang with eight thousand one hundred eighty households, titled Marquis of Jiang.

Xiang Yu arrived, made Duke Pei King of Han. The King of Han granted Bo rank as Martial Marquis. Followed in entering Hanzhong, appointed as general. Returned to pacify the Three Qins, reached Qin, granted fief in Huaide. Attacked Huaili and Haozhi, first in merit. Struck Zhao Ben and Chamberlain Bao at Xianyang, first in merit. North attacked Qi. Struck Zhang Ping and Yao Ang's army. West pacified Qian. Returned and captured Mei and Fenyang. Besieged Zhang Han at Fei Qiu. Broke the Western Chamberlain. Struck the bandit Ba army, broke it. Attacked Shangui. East guarded Yaoguan. Turned to strike Xiang Ji. Attacked Qu Ni, first in merit. Returned to guard Aocang, pursued Xiang Ji. Ji was already dead, thus east pacified Chu territory Sizui and Donghai commandery, altogether obtained twenty-two counties. Returned to guard Luoyang and Yueyang, granted to share eating Zhongli with Marquis Yingyin. As general followed Gaozu against the rebel King Yan Zang Tu, broke him at Yi Xia. The troops he led facing the imperial roadway were the most numerous. Granted rank of noble, shared the tally never to be extinguished generation after generation. Ate Jiang with eight thousand one hundred eighty households, titled Marquis of Jiang.

sentences.zh: 以將軍從高帝擊反韓王信於代，降下霍人。

translations.text: As general followed Gaozu to strike the rebel King Han Xin in Dai, surrendered and captured Huo people.

sentences.zh: 以前至武泉，擊胡騎，破之武泉北。

translations.text: Advancing first to Wuquan, struck Xiongnu cavalry, broke them north of Wuquan.

sentences.zh: 轉攻韓信軍銅鞮，破之。

translations.text: Turned to attack Han Xin's army at Tongdi, broke it.

sentences.zh: 還，降太原六城。

translations.text: Returned, surrendered six cities in Taiyuan.

sentences.zh: 擊韓信胡騎晉陽下，破之，下晉陽。

translations.text: Struck Han Xin's Xiongnu cavalry below Jinyang, broke it, captured Jinyang.

sentences.zh: 後擊韓信軍於硰石，破之，追北八十里。

translations.text: Later struck Han Xin's army at Langshi, broke it, pursued the defeated for eighty li.

sentences.zh: 還攻樓煩三城，因擊胡騎平城下，所將卒當馳道為多。

translations.text: Returned to attack three cities in Loufan, thus struck Xiongnu cavalry below Pingcheng, the troops he led facing the imperial roadway were the most numerous.

sentences.zh: 勃遷為太尉。

translations.text: Bo was promoted to Grand Commandant.

As general followed Gaozu to strike the rebel King Han Xin in Dai, surrendered and captured Huo people. Advancing first to Wuquan, struck Xiongnu cavalry, broke them north of Wuquan. Turned to attack Han Xin's army at Tongdi, broke it. Returned, surrendered six cities in Taiyuan. Struck Han Xin's Xiongnu cavalry below Jinyang, broke it, captured Jinyang. Later struck Han Xin's army at Langshi, broke it, pursued the defeated for eighty li. Returned to attack three cities in Loufan, thus struck Xiongnu cavalry below Pingcheng, the troops he led facing the imperial roadway were the most numerous. Bo was promoted to Grand Commandant.

sentences.zh: 擊陳豨，屠馬邑。

translations.text: Struck Chen Xi, slaughtered Maiyi.

sentences.zh: 所將卒斬豨將軍乘馬絺。

translations.text: The troops he led beheaded Xi's general Riding Horse Chi.

sentences.zh: 擊韓信、陳豨、趙利軍於樓煩，破之。

translations.text: Struck Han Xin, Chen Xi, Zhao Li's army at Loufan, broke it.

sentences.zh: 得豨將宋最、鴈門守圂。

translations.text: Captured Xi's generals Song Zui, Yanmen governor Chou.

sentences.zh: 因轉攻得雲中守遬、丞相箕肆、將勳。

translations.text: Thus turned to attack and captured Yunzhong governor Su, chancellor Ji Si, general Xun.

sentences.zh: 定鴈門郡十七縣，雲中郡十二縣。

translations.text: Pacified Yanmen commandery seventeen counties, Yunzhong commandery twelve counties.

sentences.zh: 因復擊豨靈丘，破之，斬豨，得豨丞相程縱、將軍陳武、都尉高肆。

translations.text: Thus again struck Xi at Lingqiu, broke it, beheaded Xi, captured Xi's chancellor Cheng Zong, general Chen Wu, commandery lieutenant Gao Si.

sentences.zh: 定代郡九縣。

translations.text: Pacified Dai commandery nine counties.

Struck Chen Xi, slaughtered Maiyi. The troops he led beheaded Xi's general Riding Horse Chi. Struck Han Xin, Chen Xi, Zhao Li's army at Loufan, broke it. Captured Xi's generals Song Zui, Yanmen governor Chou. Thus turned to attack and captured Yunzhong governor Su, chancellor Ji Si, general Xun. Pacified Yanmen commandery seventeen counties, Yunzhong commandery twelve counties. Thus again struck Xi at Lingqiu, broke it, beheaded Xi, captured Xi's chancellor Cheng Zong, general Chen Wu, commandery lieutenant Gao Si. Pacified Dai commandery nine counties.

sentences.zh: 燕王盧綰反，勃以相國代樊噲將，擊下薊，得綰大將抵、丞相偃、守陘、太尉弱、御史大夫施，屠渾都。

translations.text: King Yan Lu Wan rebelled, Bo as prime minister replaced Fan Kuai as general, struck and captured Ji, obtained Wan's great general Di, chancellor Yan, guard Xing, grand commandant Ruo, censor-in-chief Shi, slaughtered Hundu.

sentences.zh: 破綰軍上蘭，復擊破綰軍沮陽。

translations.text: Broke Wan's army at Shanglan, again struck and broke Wan's army at Juyang.

sentences.zh: 追至長城，定上谷十二縣，右北平十六縣，遼西、遼東二十九縣，漁陽二十二縣。

translations.text: Pursued to the Great Wall, pacified Shanggu twelve counties, Youbeiping sixteen counties, Liaoxi and Liaodong twenty-nine counties, Yuyang twenty-two counties.

sentences.zh: 最從高帝得相國一人，丞相二人，將軍、二千石各三人；

translations.text: First following Gaozu obtained one prime minister, two chancellors, generals and officials of 2000 shi each three each;

sentences.zh: 別破軍二，下城三，定郡五，縣七十九，得丞相、大將各一人。

translations.text: Separately broke armies two, captured cities three, pacified commanderies five, counties seventy-nine, captured chancellor and great general each one.

King Yan Lu Wan rebelled, Bo as prime minister replaced Fan Kuai as general, struck and captured Ji, obtained Wan's great general Di, chancellor Yan, guard Xing, grand commandant Ruo, censor-in-chief Shi, slaughtered Hundu. Broke Wan's army at Shanglan, again struck and broke Wan's army at Juyang. Pursued to the Great Wall, pacified Shanggu twelve counties, Youbeiping sixteen counties, Liaoxi and Liaodong twenty-nine counties, Yuyang twenty-two counties. First following Gaozu obtained one prime minister, two chancellors, generals and officials of 2000 shi each three each; Separately broke armies two, captured cities three, pacified commanderies five, counties seventy-nine, captured chancellor and great general each one.

sentences.zh: 勃為人木彊敦厚，高帝以為可屬大事。

translations.text: Bo as a person was stolid, strong, and honest, Gaozu considered him reliable for important matters.

sentences.zh: 勃不好文學，每召諸生說士，東鄉坐而責之：「趣為我語。」

translations.text: Bo did not like literature, whenever he summoned scholars and persuaders, sat facing east and urged them: 'Quickly speak for me.'

sentences.zh: 其椎少文如此。

translations.text: His simple lack of polish was like this.

Bo as a person was stolid, strong, and honest, Gaozu considered him reliable for important matters. Bo did not like literature, whenever he summoned scholars and persuaders, sat facing east and urged them: 'Quickly speak for me.' His simple lack of polish was like this.

sentences.zh: 勃既定燕而歸，高祖已崩矣，以列侯事孝惠帝。

translations.text: Bo having pacified Yan and returned, Gaozu had already passed away, served Emperor Xiaohui as a noble.

sentences.zh: 孝惠帝六年，置太尉官，以勃為太尉。

translations.text: Emperor Xiaohui year 6, established the office of Grand Commandant, appointed Bo as Grand Commandant.

sentences.zh: 十歲，高后崩。

translations.text: Ten years, Empress Gao passed away.

sentences.zh: 呂祿以趙王為漢上將軍，呂產以呂王為漢相國，秉漢權，欲危劉氏。

translations.text: Lu Lu as King of Zhao became Han Supreme General, Lu Chan as King Lu became Han Chancellor, wielded Han power, wished to endanger the Liu clan.

sentences.zh: 勃為太尉，不得入軍門。

translations.text: Bo as Grand Commandant, could not enter the army gates.

sentences.zh: 陳平為丞相，不得任事。

translations.text: Chen Ping as Chancellor, could not manage affairs.

sentences.zh: 於是勃與平謀，卒誅諸呂而立孝文皇帝。

translations.text: Thus Bo and Ping plotted, ultimately executed the various Lu and established Emperor Xiaowen.

sentences.zh: 其語在呂后、孝文事中。

translations.text: The conversation is in the Empress Lu and Xiaowen affairs.

Bo having pacified Yan and returned, Gaozu had already passed away, served Emperor Xiaohui as a noble. Emperor Xiaohui year 6, established the office of Grand Commandant, appointed Bo as Grand Commandant. Ten years, Empress Gao passed away. Lu Lu as King of Zhao became Han Supreme General, Lu Chan as King Lu became Han Chancellor, wielded Han power, wished to endanger the Liu clan. Bo as Grand Commandant, could not enter the army gates. Chen Ping as Chancellor, could not manage affairs. Thus Bo and Ping plotted, ultimately executed the various Lu and established Emperor Xiaowen. The conversation is in the Empress Lu and Xiaowen affairs.

sentences.zh: 文帝既立，以勃為右丞相，賜金五千斤，食邑萬戶。

translations.text: Emperor Wen having been established, appointed Bo as right chancellor, granted five thousand jin of gold, fief of ten thousand households.

sentences.zh: 居月餘，人或說勃曰：「君既誅諸呂，立代王，威震天下，而君受厚賞，處尊位，以寵，久之即禍及身矣。」

translations.text: After more than a month, someone advised Bo: 'Sir having executed the various Lu and established the King of Dai, your prestige shakes the realm, yet sir receives rich rewards, holds honored position in favor—after a long time calamity will reach your person.'

sentences.zh: 勃懼，亦自危，乃謝請歸相印。

translations.text: Bo feared, also felt endangered, so apologized and requested to return the chancellor seal.

sentences.zh: 上許之。

translations.text: The emperor permitted it.

sentences.zh: 歲餘，丞相平卒，上復以勃為丞相。

translations.text: More than a year, Chancellor Ping died, the emperor again appointed Bo as chancellor.

sentences.zh: 十餘月，上曰：「前日吾詔列侯就國，或未能行，丞相吾所重，其率先之。」

translations.text: More than ten months, the emperor said: 'Previously I commanded the nobles to go to their fiefs, some perhaps could not go, the chancellor I value greatly, let him lead them.'

sentences.zh: 乃免相就國。

translations.text: Thus dismissed from chancellor and went to his fief.

Emperor Wen having been established, appointed Bo as right chancellor, granted five thousand jin of gold, fief of ten thousand households. After more than a month, someone advised Bo: 'Sir having executed the various Lu and established the King of Dai, your prestige shakes the realm, yet sir receives rich rewards, holds honored position in favor—after a long time calamity will reach your person.' Bo feared, also felt endangered, so apologized and requested to return the chancellor seal. The emperor permitted it. More than a year, Chancellor Ping died, the emperor again appointed Bo as chancellor. More than ten months, the emperor said: 'Previously I commanded the nobles to go to their fiefs, some perhaps could not go, the chancellor I value greatly, let him lead them.' Thus dismissed from chancellor and went to his fief.

sentences.zh: 歲餘，每河東守尉行縣至絳，絳侯勃自畏恐誅，常被甲，令家人持兵以見之。

translations.text: More than a year, whenever the Hedong governor on circuit inspection reached Jiang, Marquis Jiang Bo fearing execution, always wore armor, ordered his family to hold weapons to see him.

sentences.zh: 其後人有上書告勃欲反，下廷尉。

translations.text: Afterwards someone submitted a memorial accusing Bo of intending rebellion, sent to the Chamberlain for Law Enforcement.

sentences.zh: 廷尉下其事長安，逮捕勃治之。

translations.text: The Chamberlain for Law Enforcement sent the matter to Chang'an, arrested Bo for investigation.

sentences.zh: 勃恐，不知置辭。

translations.text: Bo was terrified, did not know how to respond.

sentences.zh: 吏稍侵辱之。

translations.text: The officials gradually humiliated him.

sentences.zh: 勃以千金與獄吏，獄吏乃書牘背示之，曰「以公主為證」。

translations.text: Bo gave a thousand jin of gold to the prison officials, the prison officials then wrote on the back of the documents to show him, saying 'Use the princess as witness.'

sentences.zh: 公主者，孝文帝女也，勃太子勝之尚之，故獄吏教引為證。

translations.text: The princess was Emperor Xiaowen's daughter, Bo's heir Shengzhi married her, so the prison officials taught to cite her as witness.

sentences.zh: 勃之益封受賜，盡以予薄昭。

translations.text: Bo's increased enfeoffments and rewards, all gave to Bo Zhao.

sentences.zh: 及系急，薄昭為言薄太后，太后亦以為無反事。

translations.text: When the imprisonment was urgent, Bo Zhao spoke to Empress Bo, the empress also considered there was no rebellion matter.

sentences.zh: 文帝朝，太后以冒絮提文帝，曰：「絳侯綰皇帝璽，將兵於北軍，不以此時反，今居一小縣，顧欲反邪！」

translations.text: In Emperor Wen's court, the empress lifted Emperor Wen by the front of his robe, said: 'The Marquis of Jiang grasped the emperor's seal, led troops in the northern army, did not rebel at that time, now resides in a small county, why would he want to rebel!'

sentences.zh: 文帝既見絳侯獄辭，乃謝曰：「吏［事］方驗而出之。」

translations.text: Emperor Wen having seen the Marquis of Jiang's prison statement, then apologized saying: 'The official matters are being verified and he will be released.'

sentences.zh: 於是使使持節赦絳侯，復爵邑。

translations.text: Thus sent envoys holding the tally to pardon the Marquis of Jiang, restored rank and fief.

sentences.zh: 絳侯既出，曰：「吾嘗將百萬軍，然安知獄吏之貴乎！」

translations.text: The Marquis of Jiang having been released, said: 'I once commanded a million troops, yet how could I know the preciousness of prison officials!'

More than a year, whenever the Hedong governor on circuit inspection reached Jiang, Marquis Jiang Bo fearing execution, always wore armor, ordered his family to hold weapons to see him. Afterwards someone submitted a memorial accusing Bo of intending rebellion, sent to the Chamberlain for Law Enforcement. The Chamberlain for Law Enforcement sent the matter to Chang'an, arrested Bo for investigation. Bo was terrified, did not know how to respond. The officials gradually humiliated him. Bo gave a thousand jin of gold to the prison officials, the prison officials then wrote on the back of the documents to show him, saying 'Use the princess as witness.' The princess was Emperor Xiaowen's daughter, Bo's heir Shengzhi married her, so the prison officials taught to cite her as witness. Bo's increased enfeoffments and rewards, all gave to Bo Zhao. When the imprisonment was urgent, Bo Zhao spoke to Empress Bo, the empress also considered there was no rebellion matter. In Emperor Wen's court, the empress lifted Emperor Wen by the front of his robe, said: 'The Marquis of Jiang grasped the emperor's seal, led troops in the northern army, did not rebel at that time, now resides in a small county, why would he want to rebel!' Emperor Wen having seen the Marquis of Jiang's prison statement, then apologized saying: 'The official matters are being verified and he will be released.' Thus sent envoys holding the tally to pardon the Marquis of Jiang, restored rank and fief. The Marquis of Jiang having been released, said: 'I once commanded a million troops, yet how could I know the preciousness of prison officials!'

The Marquis of Jiang again went to his fief. Emperor Xiaowen year 11 died, posthumous title Marquis Wu. Son Shengzhi succeeded to the marquisate. Six years, married the princess, did not get along, because of killing someone, state abolished. Cut off for one year, Emperor Wen then selected the Marquis of Jiang's son the worthy one, Hedong governor Yafu, enfeoffed as Marquis of Tiao, continued the Marquis of Jiang's line.

sentences.zh: 條侯亞夫自未侯為河內守時，許負相之，曰：「君後三歲而侯。

sentences.zh: 然既已貴如負言，又何說餓死？

sentences.zh: 指示我。」

translations.text: Show me.'

sentences.zh: 許負指其口曰：「有從理入口，此餓死法也。」

translations.text: Xu Fu pointed to his mouth saying: 'There is a vertical line entering the mouth, this is the method of starving to death.'

sentences.zh: 居三歲，其兄絳侯勝之有罪，孝文帝擇絳侯子賢者，皆推亞夫，乃封亞夫為條侯，續絳侯後。

translations.text: After three years, his elder brother Marquis Jiang Shengzhi committed a crime, Emperor Xiaowen selected the Marquis of Jiang's worthy sons, all recommended Yafu, so enfeoffed Yafu as Marquis of Tiao, continued the Marquis of Jiang's line.

Marquis Tiao Yafu from when not yet marquis served as Hedong governor, Xu Fu physiognomized him, said: 'Sir after three years will be marquis. Marquis eight years will be general and chancellor, hold the state's reins, honored and important, among ministers unparalleled. Afterwards nine years sir will starve to death.' Yafu laughed saying: 'My elder brother has already succeeded father as marquis, if he dies, his son should succeed, why would Yafu become marquis? Yet if already honored as Fu said, why speak of starving to death? Show me.' Xu Fu pointed to his mouth saying: 'There is a vertical line entering the mouth, this is the method of starving to death.' After three years, his elder brother Marquis Jiang Shengzhi committed a crime, Emperor Xiaowen selected the Marquis of Jiang's worthy sons, all recommended Yafu, so enfeoffed Yafu as Marquis of Tiao, continued the Marquis of Jiang's line.

sentences.zh: 文帝之後六年，匈奴大入邊。

translations.text: The rampart gate soldiers and officers told the following chariots and cavalry: 'The general's agreement—no driving and galloping in the army.'

translations.text: Having left the army gate, all the ministers were astonished.

sentences.zh: 文帝曰：「嗟乎，此真將軍矣！

translations.text: Emperor Wen said: 'Alas, this is truly a general!

sentences.zh: 曩者霸上、棘門軍，若兒戲耳，其將固可襲而虜也。

translations.text: Previously the Bashang and Jimen armies were like children's play, their generals could certainly be surprised and captured.

sentences.zh: 至於亞夫，可得而犯邪！」

translations.text: As for Yafu, can he be offended?'

sentences.zh: 稱善者久之。

translations.text: Praised him for a long time.

sentences.zh: 月餘，三軍皆罷。

translations.text: More than a month, the three armies were all disbanded.

sentences.zh: 乃拜亞夫為中尉。

translations.text: Thus appointed Yafu as Commandant of the Guards.

Six years after Emperor Wen, the Xiongnu greatly invaded the border. Thus appointed the Imperial Clan Court Minister Liu Li as general, stationed at Bashang; Marquis Zhuzi Xu Li as general, stationed at Jimen; appointed Hedong governor Yafu as general, stationed at Xiliu: to prepare against the Xiongnu. The emperor personally inspected the troops. Arriving at Bashang and Jimen armies, drove straight in, the generals and below rode to greet. Soon went to the Xiliu army, the soldiers and officers wore armor, sharpened weapons and blades, drew bows and crossbows, held them at full draw. The emperor's advance guard arrived, could not enter. The advance guard said: 'The Son of Heaven is about to arrive!' The army gate commandery lieutenant said: 'The general's order says "in the army hear the general's command, not hear the Son of Heaven's decree".' Shortly after, the emperor arrived, again could not enter. Thus the emperor sent envoys holding the tally to decree the general: 'I wish to enter and inspect the army.' Yafu then transmitted orders to open the rampart gate. The rampart gate soldiers and officers told the following chariots and cavalry: 'The general's agreement—no driving and galloping in the army.' Thus the Son of Heaven held the reins and walked slowly. Arriving at the camp, General Yafu held his weapon and bowed saying: 'Armored soldiers do not bow, please receive with military ritual.' The Son of Heaven was moved, changed expression and stood in the chariot. Had someone convey thanks: 'The emperor respectfully inspects the general.' Completed the ritual and left. Having left the army gate, all the ministers were astonished. Emperor Wen said: 'Alas, this is truly a general! Previously the Bashang and Jimen armies were like children's play, their generals could certainly be surprised and captured. As for Yafu, can he be offended?' Praised him for a long time. More than a month, the three armies were all disbanded. Thus appointed Yafu as Commandant of the Guards.

sentences.zh: 孝文且崩時，誡太子曰：「即有緩急，周亞夫真可任將兵。」

translations.text: When Emperor Xiaowen was about to pass away, admonished the crown prince saying: 'If there is emergency, Zhou Yafu truly can be entrusted to lead troops.'

sentences.zh: 文帝崩，拜亞夫為車騎將軍。

translations.text: Emperor Wen passed away, appointed Yafu as Chariot and Cavalry General.

When Emperor Xiaowen was about to pass away, admonished the crown prince saying: 'If there is emergency, Zhou Yafu truly can be entrusted to lead troops.' Emperor Wen passed away, appointed Yafu as Chariot and Cavalry General.

sentences.zh: 孝景三年，吳楚反。

translations.text: Emperor Jing year 3, Wu and Chu rebelled.

sentences.zh: 亞夫以中尉為太尉，東擊吳楚。

translations.text: Yafu as Commandant of the Guards became Grand Commandant, east attacked Wu and Chu.

sentences.zh: 因自請上曰：「楚兵剽輕，難與爭鋒。

translations.text: Thus personally requested the emperor saying: 'Chu troops are fierce and swift, difficult to contend with directly.

sentences.zh: 願以梁委之，絕其糧道，乃可制。」

translations.text: Wish to entrust Liang to them, cut off their grain routes, then can control them.'

sentences.zh: 上許之。

translations.text: The emperor permitted it.

Emperor Jing year 3, Wu and Chu rebelled. Yafu as Commandant of the Guards became Grand Commandant, east attacked Wu and Chu. Thus personally requested the emperor saying: 'Chu troops are fierce and swift, difficult to contend with directly. Wish to entrust Liang to them, cut off their grain routes, then can control them.' The emperor permitted it.

sentences.zh: 太尉既會兵滎陽，吳方攻梁，梁急，請救。

translations.text: The Grand Commandant having assembled troops at Xingyang, Wu was attacking Liang, Liang was urgent, requested rescue.

sentences.zh: 太尉引兵東北走昌邑，深壁而守。

translations.text: The Grand Commandant led troops northeast to Changyi, entrenched deeply and defended.

sentences.zh: 梁日使使請太尉，太尉守便宜，不肯往。

translations.text: Liang daily sent envoys to request the Grand Commandant, the Grand Commandant held to what was advantageous, would not go.

sentences.zh: 梁上書言景帝，景帝使使詔救梁。

translations.text: Liang submitted a memorial to Emperor Jing, Emperor Jing sent envoys to decree rescue Liang.

sentences.zh: 太尉不奉詔，堅壁不出，而使輕騎兵弓高侯等絕吳楚兵後食道。

translations.text: The Grand Commandant did not obey the decree, firmly entrenched without going out, but sent light cavalry general Gonggao Hou and others to cut off Wu and Chu troops' rear grain routes.

sentences.zh: 吳兵乏糧，饑，數欲挑戰，終不出。

translations.text: Wu troops lacked grain, hungry, several times wished to challenge, ultimately did not come out.

sentences.zh: 夜，軍中驚，內相攻擊擾亂，至於太尉帳下。

translations.text: At night, the army was alarmed, internally attacked each other in confusion, reaching the Grand Commandant's tent.

sentences.zh: 太尉終臥不起。

translations.text: The Grand Commandant lay still without rising.

sentences.zh: 頃之，復定。

translations.text: After a moment, again settled.

sentences.zh: 後吳奔壁東南陬，太尉使備西北。

translations.text: Later Wu fled toward the southeast corner of the wall, the Grand Commandant had them prepare northwest.

sentences.zh: 已而其精兵果奔西北，不得入。

translations.text: Soon their elite troops indeed fled northwest, could not enter.

sentences.zh: 吳兵既餓，乃引而去。

translations.text: Wu troops having starved, then led away.

sentences.zh: 太尉出精兵追擊，大破之。

translations.text: The Grand Commandant sent out elite troops to pursue and strike, greatly broke them.

sentences.zh: 吳王濞棄其軍，而與壯士數千人亡走，保於江南丹徒。

translations.text: Wu King Bi abandoned his army, and with several thousand strong men fled and ran, defended in Jiangnan Dantu.

sentences.zh: 漢兵因乘勝，遂盡虜之，降其兵，購吳王千金。

translations.text: Han troops thus took advantage of victory, completely captured them, surrendered their troops, offered thousand jin bounty for Wu King.

sentences.zh: 月餘，越人斬吳王頭以告。

translations.text: More than a month, Yue people beheaded Wu King to report.

sentences.zh: 凡相攻守三月，而吳楚破平。

translations.text: Altogether attacked and defended three months, Wu and Chu were broken and pacified.

sentences.zh: 於是諸將乃以太尉計謀為是。

translations.text: Thus the generals considered the Grand Commandant's strategy correct.

sentences.zh: 由此梁孝王與太尉有卻。

translations.text: From this Liang Xiaowang had resentment toward the Grand Commandant.

The Grand Commandant having assembled troops at Xingyang, Wu was attacking Liang, Liang was urgent, requested rescue. The Grand Commandant led troops northeast to Changyi, entrenched deeply and defended. Liang daily sent envoys to request the Grand Commandant, the Grand Commandant held to what was advantageous, would not go. Liang submitted a memorial to Emperor Jing, Emperor Jing sent envoys to decree rescue Liang. The Grand Commandant did not obey the decree, firmly entrenched without going out, but sent light cavalry general Gonggao Hou and others to cut off Wu and Chu troops' rear grain routes. Wu troops lacked grain, hungry, several times wished to challenge, ultimately did not come out. At night, the army was alarmed, internally attacked each other in confusion, reaching the Grand Commandant's tent. The Grand Commandant lay still without rising. After a moment, again settled. Later Wu fled toward the southeast corner of the wall, the Grand Commandant had them prepare northwest. Soon their elite troops indeed fled northwest, could not enter. Wu troops having starved, then led away. The Grand Commandant sent out elite troops to pursue and strike, greatly broke them. Wu King Bi abandoned his army, and with several thousand strong men fled and ran, defended in Jiangnan Dantu. Han troops thus took advantage of victory, completely captured them, surrendered their troops, offered thousand jin bounty for Wu King. More than a month, Yue people beheaded Wu King to report. Altogether attacked and defended three months, Wu and Chu were broken and pacified. Thus the generals considered the Grand Commandant's strategy correct. From this Liang Xiaowang had resentment toward the Grand Commandant.

sentences.zh: 歸，復置太尉官。

translations.text: Returned, again established the Grand Commandant office.

sentences.zh: 五歲，遷為丞相，景帝甚重之。

translations.text: Five years, promoted to chancellor, Emperor Jing greatly valued him.

sentences.zh: 景帝廢栗太子，丞相固爭之，不得。

translations.text: Emperor Jing deposed Crown Prince Li, the chancellor firmly contended against it, could not prevail.

sentences.zh: 景帝由此疏之。

translations.text: Emperor Jing from this distanced him.

sentences.zh: 而梁孝王每朝，常與太后言條侯之短。

Returned, again established the Grand Commandant office. Five years, promoted to chancellor, Emperor Jing greatly valued him. Emperor Jing deposed Crown Prince Li, the chancellor firmly contended against it, could not prevail. Emperor Jing from this distanced him. Moreover Liang Xiaowang each court audience, often spoke of Marquis Tiao's faults to the empress dowager.

sentences.zh: 竇太后曰：「皇后兄王信可侯也。」

translations.text: Empress Dowager Dou said: 'The queen's elder brother Wang Xin can be made marquis.'

sentences.zh: 景帝讓曰：「始南皮、章武侯先帝不侯，及臣即位乃侯之。

translations.text: Emperor Jing declined saying: 'Originally Nanpi and Zhangwu marquises the late emperor did not make marquises, when I ascended the throne then made them marquises.

sentences.zh: 信未得封也。」

translations.text: Xin has not yet received enfeoffment.'

sentences.zh: 竇太后曰：「人主各以時行耳。

translations.text: Empress Dowager Dou said: 'Rulers each act according to their time.

sentences.zh: 自竇長君在時，竟不得侯，死後乃［封］其子彭祖顧得侯。

translations.text: From when Dou Changjun was alive, ultimately could not become marquis, after death then [enfeoffed] his son Pengzu and he became marquis.

sentences.zh: 吾甚恨之。

translations.text: I greatly resent it.

sentences.zh: 帝趣侯信也！」

translations.text: Your majesty quickly make Xin marquis!'

sentences.zh: 景帝曰：「請得與丞相議之。」

translations.text: Emperor Jing said: 'Please allow me to discuss with the chancellor.'

sentences.zh: 丞相議之，亞夫曰：「高皇帝約『非劉氏不得王，非有功不得侯。

translations.text: Discussed with the chancellor, Yafu said: 'Gaozu's covenant "non-Liu clan may not become kings, without merit may not become marquises.

sentences.zh: 不如約，天下共擊之』。

translations.text: If not follow the covenant, the realm together will attack them".'

sentences.zh: 今信雖皇后兄，無功，侯之，非約也。」

translations.text: Now Xin though queen's elder brother, without merit, make him marquis, not follow the covenant.'

sentences.zh: 景帝默然而止。

translations.text: Emperor Jing was silent and stopped.

Empress Dowager Dou said: 'The queen's elder brother Wang Xin can be made marquis.' Emperor Jing declined saying: 'Originally Nanpi and Zhangwu marquises the late emperor did not make marquises, when I ascended the throne then made them marquises. Xin has not yet received enfeoffment.' Empress Dowager Dou said: 'Rulers each act according to their time. From when Dou Changjun was alive, ultimately could not become marquis, after death then [enfeoffed] his son Pengzu and he became marquis. I greatly resent it. Your majesty quickly make Xin marquis!' Emperor Jing said: 'Please allow me to discuss with the chancellor.' Discussed with the chancellor, Yafu said: 'Gaozu's covenant "non-Liu clan may not become kings, without merit may not become marquises. If not follow the covenant, the realm together will attack them".' Now Xin though queen's elder brother, without merit, make him marquis, not follow the covenant.' Emperor Jing was silent and stopped.

sentences.zh: 其後匈奴王［唯］徐盧等五人降，景帝欲侯之以勸後。

translations.text: Afterwards Xiongnu kings [Wei] Xu Lu and others five people surrendered, Emperor Jing wished to make them marquises to encourage later surrenders.

sentences.zh: 丞相亞夫曰：「彼背其主降陛下，陛下侯之，則何以責人臣不守節者乎？」

translations.text: Chancellor Yafu said: 'They betrayed their lord and surrendered to your majesty, your majesty makes them marquises, then how to blame ministers who do not maintain loyalty?'

sentences.zh: 景帝曰：「丞相議不可用。」

translations.text: Emperor Jing said: 'The chancellor's counsel cannot be used.'

sentences.zh: 乃悉封［唯］徐盧等為列侯。

translations.text: Thus all enfeoffed [Wei] Xu Lu and others as nobles.

sentences.zh: 亞夫因謝病。

translations.text: Yafu thus pleaded illness.

sentences.zh: 景帝中三年，以病免相。

translations.text: Emperor Jing middle year 3, because of illness dismissed from chancellor.

Afterwards Xiongnu kings [Wei] Xu Lu and others five people surrendered, Emperor Jing wished to make them marquises to encourage later surrenders. Chancellor Yafu said: 'They betrayed their lord and surrendered to your majesty, your majesty makes them marquises, then how to blame ministers who do not maintain loyalty?' Emperor Jing said: 'The chancellor's counsel cannot be used.' Thus all enfeoffed [Wei] Xu Lu and others as nobles. Yafu thus pleaded illness. Emperor Jing middle year 3, because of illness dismissed from chancellor.

sentences.zh: 頃之，景帝居禁中，召條侯，賜食。

translations.text: Shortly after, Emperor Jing resided in the inner palace, summoned Marquis Tiao, granted food.

sentences.zh: 獨置大胾，無切肉，又不置櫡。

translations.text: Alone placed a large joint of meat, no knife for cutting, also did not place chopsticks.

sentences.zh: 條侯心不平，顧謂尚席取櫡。

translations.text: Marquis Tiao's heart was not at peace, turned and told the food attendant to get chopsticks.

sentences.zh: 景帝視而笑曰：「此不足君所乎？」

translations.text: Emperor Jing watched and laughed saying: 'This is not enough for sir?'

sentences.zh: 條侯免冠謝。

translations.text: Marquis Tiao removed his cap and apologized.

sentences.zh: 上起，條侯因趨出。

translations.text: The emperor rose, Marquis Tiao thus hurried out.

sentences.zh: 景帝以目送之，曰：「此怏怏者非少主臣也！」

translations.text: Emperor Jing followed with his eyes, said: 'This discontented one is not a minister for a young lord!'

Shortly after, Emperor Jing resided in the inner palace, summoned Marquis Tiao, granted food. Alone placed a large joint of meat, no knife for cutting, also did not place chopsticks. Marquis Tiao's heart was not at peace, turned and told the food attendant to get chopsticks. Emperor Jing watched and laughed saying: 'This is not enough for sir?' Marquis Tiao removed his cap and apologized. The emperor rose, Marquis Tiao thus hurried out. Emperor Jing followed with his eyes, said: 'This discontented one is not a minister for a young lord!'

sentences.zh: 居無何，條侯子為父買工官尚方甲楯五百被可以葬者。

translations.text: After not long, Marquis Tiao's son for father bought from the artisan office Shangfang five hundred suits of armor and shields that could be used for burial.

sentences.zh: 取庸苦之，不予錢。

translations.text: Took laborers to work them hard, did not give money.

sentences.zh: 庸知其盜買縣官器，怒而上變告子，事連汙條侯。

translations.text: The laborers knew they were illicitly buying government equipment, angered and reported the irregularity, accusing the son, the matter implicated and defiled Marquis Tiao.

sentences.zh: 書既聞上，上下吏。

translations.text: The memorial having reached the emperor, sent down officials.

sentences.zh: 吏簿責條侯，條侯不對。

translations.text: The officials interrogated Marquis Tiao according to the records, Marquis Tiao did not answer.

sentences.zh: 景帝罵之曰：「吾不用也。」

translations.text: Emperor Jing cursed saying: 'I will not employ you.'

sentences.zh: 召詣廷尉。

translations.text: Summoned to the Chamberlain for Law Enforcement.

sentences.zh: 廷尉責曰：「君侯欲反邪？」

translations.text: The Chamberlain for Law Enforcement interrogated saying: 'Marquis wishes to rebel?'

sentences.zh: 亞夫曰：「臣所買器，乃葬器也，何謂反邪？」

translations.text: Yafu said: 'What your servant bought were burial items, why speak of rebellion?'

sentences.zh: 吏曰：「君侯縱不反地上，即欲反地下耳。」

translations.text: The officials said: 'Even if marquis does not rebel on the earth, he wishes to rebel under the earth.'

sentences.zh: 吏侵之益急。

translations.text: The officials pressed him increasingly urgently.

sentences.zh: 初，吏捕條侯，條侯欲自殺，夫人止之，以故不得死，遂入廷尉。

translations.text: Initially when officials arrested Marquis Tiao, Marquis Tiao wished to commit suicide, his wife stopped him, because of this could not die, thus entered the Chamberlain for Law Enforcement.

sentences.zh: 因不食五日，嘔血而死。

translations.text: Thus did not eat for five days, vomited blood and died.

sentences.zh: 國除。

translations.text: State abolished.

After not long, Marquis Tiao's son for father bought from the artisan office Shangfang five hundred suits of armor and shields that could be used for burial. Took laborers to work them hard, did not give money. The laborers knew they were illicitly buying government equipment, angered and reported the irregularity, accusing the son, the matter implicated and defiled Marquis Tiao. The memorial having reached the emperor, sent down officials. The officials interrogated Marquis Tiao according to the records, Marquis Tiao did not answer. Emperor Jing cursed saying: 'I will not employ you.' Summoned to the Chamberlain for Law Enforcement. The Chamberlain for Law Enforcement interrogated saying: 'Marquis wishes to rebel?' Yafu said: 'What your servant bought were burial items, why speak of rebellion?' The officials said: 'Even if marquis does not rebel on the earth, he wishes to rebel under the earth.' The officials pressed him increasingly urgently. Initially when officials arrested Marquis Tiao, Marquis Tiao wished to commit suicide, his wife stopped him, because of this could not die, thus entered the Chamberlain for Law Enforcement. Thus did not eat for five days, vomited blood and died. State abolished.

sentences.zh: 絕一歲，景帝乃更封絳侯勃他子堅為平曲侯，續絳侯後。

translations.text: Cut off for one year, Emperor Jing then re-enfeoffed Marquis Jiang Bo's other son Jian as Marquis of Pingqu, continued the Marquis of Jiang's line.

sentences.zh: 十九年卒，謚為共侯。

translations.text: Nineteen years died, posthumous title Marquis Gong.

sentences.zh: 子建德代侯，十三年，為太子太傅。

translations.text: Son Jiande succeeded to the marquisate, thirteen years, served as crown prince tutor.

sentences.zh: 坐酎金不善，元鼎五年，有罪，國除。

translations.text: Because of unsatisfactory tribute wine, Yuanding year 5, had crime, state abolished.

Cut off for one year, Emperor Jing then re-enfeoffed Marquis Jiang Bo's other son Jian as Marquis of Pingqu, continued the Marquis of Jiang's line. Nineteen years died, posthumous title Marquis Gong. Son Jiande succeeded to the marquisate, thirteen years, served as crown prince tutor. Because of unsatisfactory tribute wine, Yuanding year 5, had crime, state abolished.

sentences.zh: 條侯果餓死。

translations.text: Marquis Tiao indeed starved to death.

sentences.zh: 死後，景帝乃封王信為蓋侯。

translations.text: After death, Emperor Jing then enfeoffed Wang Xin as Marquis of Gai.
Marquis Tiao indeed starved to death. After death, Emperor Jing then enfeoffed Wang Xin as Marquis of Gai.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：絳侯周勃始為布衣時，鄙樸人也，才能不過凡庸。

translations.text: The Grand Historian says: Marquis Jiang Zhou Bo when beginning as commoner, was a vulgar rustic, ability no more than ordinary.

sentences.zh: 及從高祖定天下，在將相位，諸呂欲作亂，勃匡國家難，復之乎正。

translations.text: When followed Gaozu to settle the realm, in general and chancellor position, the various Lü wished to make rebellion, Bo rectified the state's difficulties, returned it to correctness.

sentences.zh: 雖伊尹、周公，何以加哉！

translations.text: Even Yi Yin and Zhou Gong, what could surpass this!

sentences.zh: 亞夫之用兵，持威重，執堅刃，穰苴曷有加焉！

translations.text: Yafu's use of troops, held authority and weight, grasped firm blade, Rang Ju what could surpass this!

sentences.zh: 足己而不學，守節不遜，終以窮困。

translations.text: Self-sufficient without learning, maintained integrity without yielding, ultimately ended in poverty.

sentences.zh: 悲夫！

translations.text: Alas!

The Grand Historian says: Marquis Jiang Zhou Bo when beginning as commoner, was a vulgar rustic, ability no more than ordinary. When followed Gaozu to settle the realm, in general and chancellor position, the various Lü wished to make rebellion, Bo rectified the state's difficulties, returned it to correctness. Even Yi Yin and Zhou Gong, what could surpass this! Yafu's use of troops, held authority and weight, grasped firm blade, Rang Ju what could surpass this! Self-sufficient without learning, maintained integrity without yielding, ultimately ended in poverty. Alas!
